headline: Slow Cooker Lentil and Ham Soup
description: This slow cooker lentil soup features ham, celery, carrots, and onion simmered in a tomatoey broth with basil, oregano, and thyme for a soothing meal.
name: Slow Cooker Lentil and Ham Soup

recipeInstructions.text: Combine ham, lentils, celery, carrots, onion, and garlic in a 3 1/2-quart or larger slow cooker. Season with basil, oregano, thyme, pepper, and bay leaf. Stir in chicken broth, water, and tomato sauce.
Cover and cook on Low for 11 hours. Discard bay leaf before serving.

review.reviewBody: added a whole small can of tomato sauce and doubled the recipe, and it was delicious.
I thought it was bland on its own, but when I put it on top of some brown rice and added some Sriracha it became fabulous!
delicious!
I added spinach and cooked on low for 4-5 hours.

I should have trusted my initial instincts regarding the spices listed, but because of the rating decided to try it. The spices overwhelmed this dish, the fact that salt wasn't listed should have been another red flag. Good base but next time will omit the 3 strong italian spices and try just used what my gut was telling me cajun spice instead. 11 hrs on low didn't cut it for french green lentils, 5 hrs on high did though.
Prepared this for a diabetic. I added bell pepper and zuchini squash and a can of diced tomatoes. Cooked in my instant pot.

This soup is very good. I made it mostly as is but just half of the recipe. I also cooked this on the stove for about 45-50 minutes at a low simmer after boiling all for about 5 minutes. The reason for my 4 stars is because I truly believe the soup needs a bit more tomato whether it is in sauce form or with actual crushed or diced tomatoes. Tomato gives it color and more flavor. It was looking too pale and unappealing with the amount of tomato sauce the recipe calls for. Also, if you wish I highly recommend using actual crushed tomatoes for a bit creamier than brothy result. Will make it again with my tomato suggestions.
Mmmm. Only had 3 hours so pressure cooker in instant pot 8 minutes and then left on keep warm. Wonderful seasoned soup!
I added some dry white wine, cayenne, and dried chipotle pepper flakes, and substituted tomato paste for the tomato sauce. It was amazing!

It's in my slow cooker right now. Smells delightful. I added a teaspoon of salt and an 8 ounce can of tomato sauce for the 8 teaspoons called for (odd amount, in my opinion). 
After reading many comments, I decided to cook on high for four hours, and will probably give it a stir midway. Looking forward to eating this! I like to add some shredded cheese and possibly some hot sauce for my serving.

I thought the flavor was lackluster. Not sure if some salt might have helped, but I wanted to keep it low sodium. I also thought 11 hours was a bit long since lentils don't need a lot of cooking time. I cooked for about 9 hours and the thickness was just fine. Maybe a little soy sauce or balsamic would kick the flavor up a notch.
My husband and I absolutely loved it. It was absolutely delicious
This was excellent, a nice new addition to my menu. Instead of the tomato paste I used a can of diced tomatoes. I substituted oregano for the bay leaf. Everyone here loved it.

I agree with those who said it lacked flavor. After looking at a couple of the reviews I decided to saute the onions and celery in butter to give them a little flavor. I also used a can of fire roasted diced tomatoes because I didn't have much tomato sauce. That still didn't add enough flavor for me so I added a bit of Lipton Garlic Herb soup mix that I had on hand and that added enough flavor to satisfy me.

This recipe is a great base start, but by just reading the recipe and following it, it sounds extremely bland. This sounds like a recipe for someone who is diabetic or cannot have too much flavor due to stomach/GI issues. I added 2 smoked ham hocks, more garlic, Sazón along with a few other things I don’t remember. Came out awesome!

I don’t like to write a review if I haven’t followed the exact recipe, but this soup was wonderful. I didn’t put the ham in, which would have added to the wonderful taste. Thickened nicely, which is how we like it. This is a keeper.
Very good and thick. Cooked for 10 hours. I may try cooktop next time, like others suggested

Definitely needs more ham even with the additional 1/2 C I added. I used a pint of home-canned crushed tomatoes instead of the tomato sauce. Next time I might try some diced zucchini in addition to the other vegetables.
The soup was just ok. Not recipe I would make again. I found the diced ham out of place.

Very tasty! I used more garlic and added cumin. Sauteed garlic and onion in olive oil. Then, added tomato sauce and a bit of chicken broth and the rest of the ingredients to simmer a bit before adding the rest of the chicken broth. Cooked on the stove-top for an hour. Best soup I've had in a while.
Yummy on a cold evening! Instead of pieces of ham, I used a leftover ham-hock. Wonderful flavor. Cooked for 6 hours in my slow cooker and it was fine.
I used canned lentils bc I didn’t have the patience for 11 hrs and the soup was great, loved it !

I made this soup as is. It was good but the seasoning was off for me. My first thought was the combination of thyme, oregano, and basil, was too strong. I think next time I make it I will back off some on those spices, and as others have done, consider a can of stewed tomatoes instead of the tomato paste.

I cooked it for 4 hours on high, and then gave it one hour on low until dinner time. Perfect!

My only ingredient change was that I added a little chili powder (because I read that it might need a little kick and I like spicy food). That was my only mistake- tasted great, but the chili powder was unnecessary (actually detracted). Leave it alone.
Wonderful

I did this in the slow cooker for 4 hours and 10 hours. I will review both. ***4 HOURS on high*** this came out like the photo. It was soupy and yummy, nothing wrong here. Light meal. ***10 HOURS on low***no liquid left, flavorful but closer to a mashed potatoe ordeal. Heavy meal. ***VERDICT*** would do it for 4 hours on high next time. As it makes for a lighter meal and yields more.

I used 2 cups of lentils and used stewed tomatoes, but all of the rest was as per the recipe. I thought it was good but I've had better. I also threw everything in the crockpot and cooked for about 4 hours.

This was very tasty. I increased the thyme. Added a lot of black pepper. I also did what others suggested and put it on high for (4) hrs. I did have to add chicken broth so it would not be a "stew". My husband loved it. I will be making this again. Hope it freezes well.

I would have given 5 stars, but I changed the recipe in three ways. Then it became a five star dish. First I put a leftover ham bone in with the lentils for a couple of hours before adding all the other ingredients. Second, I sauteed the onions, some shallots and celery before adding to soup. Lastly, I added homemade tomato paste. This was five stars and will make again with other beans.

Very good! We wanted to make split pea but only had lentils. I'll definitely be making this again though. We had all the spices, but substituted celery with broccoli and cauliflower leaves and whole cherry tomatoes for the tomato sauce. So this recipe does very well with substitutes. Worked perfectly. Thought about adding salt. Glad we didn't since the ham was so salty.
This turned out amazing! The husband was super impressed! I tweaked it a bit for his liking!
Really good soup. I used great northern beans instead of lentils and it turned out great!
This soup is delicious! First time I have ever had lentils, they were very good. My husband said this recipe is a keeper!!
Delicious! I doubled the recipe, using leftover brown sugar spiral ham, which gave it a nice sweet savory flavor. I also left out the water because my crock pot was maxed out! I will do this again!
Great recipe. I made it in my pressure cooker and it only took an hour. Thanks for sharing.

So tasty! Cook time adjustment - I started at noon with two hours of the time on high. It was delicious at 7:00. Maybe it would’ve been thicker had I cooked it 11 hours. Added a little more chicken broth toward the end. I will use low sodium chicken broth if I had it next time due to the saltiness of the ham. Thank you for sharing!
Excellent recipe, thank you!
Loved it, super simple week night meal that was awesome. made corn muffins to go along.
We found it kind of bland. Very pretty though. I’ll add tomatoes and more seasoning next time if I make it again.
Grilled Pork chops instead of ham.
Only because I wanted to try something different, I used smoked sausage. I'll use ham the next time I make it, but it was good. Also, I used about a half cup of tomato sauce for more flavor.

11 hours too long on low! done in 6.5 hrs
doubled the ham, 2 lbs just right
added more celery. maybe more carrots next time.
maybe more water. pretty chunky like a stew. not a soup.
used 4 colors of lentils for visual appeal

This is a regular family favorite and a 'go to ' recipe for a left-over ham bone. We have made it as written but more often would use half barley and half lentils. It doubles easily if your slow cooker has the space and freezes well too.

I’ve made so many recipes from allrecipes and loved many of them but this is the first time I used my instant pot and tried this recipes! It was amazing! The only problem is I need to double it next time we ate almost all of it for dinner for two people. I followed everything exactly and it was perfect. Will make it every time we have Kirkland ham! Thanks for the recipe.

Yummy and easy soup. I reduced cooking time to 8 hours on low and used the entire can of tomato sauce. Next time I will use at least 2 cups of chopped ham. One and a half cups was not enough. Excellent served with corn bread.
I used a pint of stewed tomatoes rather than tomato sauce and it was delicious!!
I made it in the he stove and it was absolutely delicious!
Good, solid soup! Good taste for little effort. Husband enjoyed!

My husband and I loved this soup. Based on the reviews, I used a can of diced tomatoes instead of tomato sauce. I also did not have ham so used chicken sausage. When it was done, I felt that there was not enough lentils so I cooked up another cup of lentils and added to soup. Delicious and so easy!

This was just ok. I knew there would be a problem as soon as I looked at the ratios of spices to the amount of the other ingredients. I did extra on all the spices and it still was just ok. I wouldn't make it again.

This is a great soup for a cold day. We had it for the first time last night, didn't add anything and it turned out so good we had 2nds. Also a great recipe for adding other veggies like tomato or potato, just to fill it in or to bulk it . Also, add whatever you want for flavor. Lentils are kinda bland.

I keep trying to find a way to make lentils that my family will actually eat, and this was successful (except for the 7yo who doesn't like anything). I used a can of diced tomatoes instead of the 8tsp of sauce, and it made it too salty for us. I still like the tomatoes but would use unsalted next time. It would be great with a sweet cornbread.

Yummy. I made this soup with a smoked ham hock from the butcher and it was rich with flavor. The only change I made to the recipe is I added to carrots & celery in the last 3 hours of cooking to ensure they weren't overcooked. Will definitely be making this recipe again!
A very easy and tasty way to make Lentils palatable.
Absolutely Fabulous
Delicious!!! It was received by friends and family alike with great acclamation! It’s definitely going to be made again!!
It turned out a little thinner than the lentil soup I remember from my youth, but it’s a good recipe.
Made this as our traditional New years Meal- Delicious! increased the spices and liquids great hearty meal I have made this throughout the year good healthy soup
I put it for 4 hours on high on the slow cooker and it was PERFECT!!
I didn't have tomato sauce so added paste and diced tomatoes instead. I added a ham bone and a parmesan cheese rind and let it cook for 9 hours. Great tasting and comforting!

This soup was very filling and delicious. The only thing I did
differently was I added a can of crushed tomatoes. I enjoyed it with a side of cornbread, a puzzle and some music at my kitchen table.
This is really easy to make! and it tastes great. You know what?> Call me crazy, but I think this would make an interesting Manhattan Clam chowder. Substitute the ham with clam. mmmmmmmm
I would add a little salt if I make it again

This soup is always a hit in our house. I have made in my instant pot pressure cooker when I forgot or didn't have time in the morning. Always amazing! I usually never have ham though but since I'm polish I always make sure to have polish sausage in the freezer so I add a pound of if (sliced). Delicious! Kids love it too!
Good. Added sliced potatoes and cayenne pepper. Threw in a half ham. Cooked on high for four hours and the ham fell apart nicely. A good way to use up some ham and lentils.

I forgot to add in the carrots!! :( Oh well. It's still good. I was worried it would be bland but it's very flavorful... Almost too flavorful. I added in a can of crushed tomatoes with garlic, basil, and oregano already added in instead of tomato sauce because I wanted to bulk it up. I also used all chicken broth and no water. I think the next time I make this I will use the water and remember the carrots. Overall I'm pretty satisfied with this recipe. I ended up cooking it for the whole 11 hours because we had a situation come up and weren't able to eat until late. 

Update: As I'm typing this, my husband tells me it's really good and he really likes it! I have NEVER heard him say that about any soup!! So I guess I'll make it again the same exact way with all chicken broth but I am on the fence about the carrots now.... And so with that update, I bump the rating from like it, to love it. Because for a soup to get a compliment from.my husband is a BIG deal!!

Delicious flavor and texture as written, but I like to use up what's on-hand so: I used a can of diced tomato instead of the sauce, added a sweet potato, and increased the veggies, lentils and water - no need to increase the seasoning. Would have been very good with corn muffins, biscuits, or even over pasta.

I cooked my soup on high for about five hours but the lentils were very hard. I ended up having to dump everything into a big pot and boil the rest of it. I am sad and very disappointed. Does it really take 11 hours on low?
I fixed in Insta Pot and it was great...took only 30 minutes after pressure built up.
I make this all the time, it's very good and simple to make. Wouldn't change anything about it except I add parmesan cheese on top when serving, gives it a little extra creaminess.

Has a great, rich, robust flavor. As others recommended, I doubled the amount of lentils, used a 15oz can of tomato sauce, and a 15oz can of diced tomatoes to boost the liquid content. Made this using my Express Crock slow cooker function and cooked it for the full 11 hours. Turned out delicious! Keeps well in the refrigerator.
This was incredibly bland, I had to do a lot of doctoring to make it palatable. Won't make again.
Used can of stewed tomatoes & 2 cans of chicken broth and 1/4 cup water. Consistency was good and it was a hit. Good idea to use ham from a previous dinner.

My husband and I enjoyed this soup! I cooked it with a hambone plus a little more ham. I had no tomato sauce or canned tomatoes, so I added what I had in the pantry -- Ro-tel tomatoes! It was a little spicy, but not terribly so. I think next time I will add a few potatoes to this soup. Also, I cooked it on the stove rather than my slow cooker. The Ro-tel tomatoes might be too spicy when cooked for a long time!

This is a great recipe. I used a can of stewed tomatoes in place of the tomato sauce and frozen beans from the garden in place of the lentils because that is what I had on hand. No changes are needed AT ALL!

Easiest and most tasty soup ever! I used some frozen left over ham cubes from the holidays and pre-packed the lentils, spices, and vegetables in separate baggies. Rather than chicken broth, I used powdered bouillon . I also used the diced tomatoes recommended. The morning of, it took about 2 minutes to layer the ham, veggies, lentils, spices, and cover pour about 4 cups of water over it. I also omitted the smoke flavoring and used Bragg's amino acid flavoring in place of the Worcestershire sauce. My daughter who is not a 'soup person' enjoyed it. There are left overs for two to three more meals, so it is cost effective. Definitely a hit served with cornbread:)
Yes was so good I will make it again!!!!
made almost as written except i added 2 tbs. of brown sugar, and a can of diced tomatoes. Next time i will add a can of rot-el in place of the diced tomatoes.

I will make this again! When I make soup, it is usually a full pot. I like to share with others and freeze some for later.
This recipe makes a smaller quantity. Perfect for 4-5 servings.
I doubled the tomato sauce.
Increased the amount of ham.
Additional 2c of chicken broth

Cooked on low in a slow cooker over night, then added the ham in the morning and increased to high for another 2hr.

This soup had a wonderful flavor. Instead of using my crock pot, I simmered on the stove for about 4 hours. I used one cup of "15 bean soup" bean packet which really added variety to the soup. Great soup that I will definitely make again. Thanks for sharing this recipe!!
Really good! I followed recipe exactly.
I thought this would be good, but the flavors in this soup were intense and just too much! I couldn't eat it.

The ONLY change I made was I used just a pinch of thyme the second time around. I thought the thyme was overbearing even though it was 1/4 tsp. I can see that stewed or diced tomatoes would enhance this soup (stew) It is a comfort soup at it's finest!
My family loved it! I didn't have the tomato sauce so used paste. Other than that I followed the recipe, cooked it on high since it was noon and it was ready by 5:30 PM.
I've made this soup for years except I always add smoked ham hocks to increase the flavor. I do not add the other spices as they're not necessary with the flavor from the smoked ham hocks!
I followed the directions.The soup is delicious

This recipe was super easy to make and I think will reheat well. I'm so used to cooking vegetarian soups that often need extra flavor, so I used 5 cups broth instead of 4 cups broth and one cup water which was a mistake, it was too salty. Might do 3.5 cups broth and 1.5 cups water next time. Otherwise no changes for next time. 

Oh, I didn't have tomato sauce but I had paste, so I did 6 tsp paste instead of 8 tsp sauce and that worked out fine.

UPDATE: Made a second time with 4 cups broth, only had 1 c of ham so added extra veggies. Was done cooking after 4 hr on low, at 11 hr this soup would be mush. Highly recommend!

Surprisingly, really good! I'm generally not much of a bean soup-type girl. Lentils gave the soup thickness but not so much of the soft grit-like thickness that I don't really like from most if not all bean soups (Lentil first timer here). I'll start by saying that I only had half the amount of broth available, so I halved everything else. GREAT flavor, I did include chopped up tomato (on top of tomato sauce - needed to get rid of it), and probably at least 3x ham the recipe called for (post-thanksgiving leftovers, reason for recipe search..and I STILL have ham leftovers to use!! lol), and about 1Tbsp of of pepper flakes to give it a good kick. I only let it cook for maybe 6 hours because I fell asleep and got paranoid leaving it to cook on the stove all night without monitoring. Started around 8pm, woke up around 1am, stirred and shut off...10am nice a thickened up soup..YUMMY! So, I just let residual heat continue heating as much as it could before it started cooling down. By am it was pretty much room temp, so I just zapped a bowl in the microwave - I wasn't cooking for anyone so it was perfect for me. Maybe plan accordingly (start in the am) if you're able to monitor throughout until it's ready for supper after 11 hours, but I thought it was pretty good how I did it, and saved on energy bill, lol.

Excellent recipe for leftover ham!! I was pressed on time and made on stove top. The celery, carrots, onions, and garlic I chopped in my food processor. I added olive oil to the bottom the the pot and simmered the veggies garlic and spices together. Then I added the ham, stock, water, and tomato sauce. I put a whole 8oz can in the soup. I simmered everything together for about 45min until the lentils were cooked through. It came out delish!! So happy with this and I will definitely be making this again.

Very tasty! Only changes i made were using a whole 8 oz can of tomato sauce and cooking it on low for a couple hours and then on high for 3. Great with a drizzle of EVOO on top and homemade cornbread! I've made this several times, but this is how i made it this time around.

This was fantastic, Great flavor. I didn't use tomato sauce, just half a can of drained diced tomatoes . Stuck to the recommended 1 cup of water and 32 oz of broth. Added some Worcestershire and Sriracha. Cooked on high for 6 hours as opposed to the recommended 11 on slow, worked out just fine. No issues with lentils. I'll make and tinker with this one again for sure.
This is my favorite slow cooker recipe, and the most delicious lentil soup. The recipe as written is perfect, but I add a little extra water and about half tsp of chili sauce.
I cooked it 4 hours on high setting and it was awesome :)
Hearty soup, great for a cold Fall day. Will definitely make again.

Made the lentil soup, but with a few changes. Poached jalapeno sausages, then chopped and added the sausages and some of the poaching water. Also, added a good size pinch of dried pepper flakes to the crock pot. We like our soups a little spicy.
This was really good! I had pancetta so I used that in place of the ham, gave it a nice smokiness. Also used some diced tomatoes instead of tomato sauce. Will definitely be trying this again!

I made it stove top, for dinner. Unless you really, really like salt, skip it if you are adding ham, as ham has plenty of it. I'd never cooked with lentils before, but heard of their healthy qualities, tossed in 1/2 a cup and wah-la, they were tender pretty quickly. I omitted the tomato sauce, didn't have any. I'll be making this again!
This was a really good soup like by all. Nothing unusual about it. Just good home cooked soup. Will make again.

This was fantastic. Great texture, chunkiness, and flavor. The seasonings were perfect. The changes I made were:

*Used 1 C chopped cauliflower (small, like rice grains)
*Used 14 oz. can of stewed tomatoes instead of 8 T tomato sauce
*Added 8 oz. sliced mushrooms
*Used 16 oz. bag of lentils instead of 1 cup
*Used 49 oz. can of chicken broth (instead of what recipe used)

I cooked it overnight on low for about 11-12 hours. Was perfect. Could've used a bit more ham than I had, though.

item.name: Slow Cooker Lentil and Ham Soup
